abstract: Iranian authorities widen their investigation into what they say is a record $2.6 billion embezzlement uncovered in a network of Iranian banks; case was first identified at Bank Melli, Iran's largest commercial bank, in September.
snippet: The top prosecutor says 67 people have been interrogated, 31 have been arrested and the main suspect, hiding in Canada, may be sought for extradition through an Interpol warrant.
lead_paragraph: The top prosecutor says 67 people have been interrogated, 31 have been arrested and the main suspect, hiding in Canada, may be sought for extradition through an Interpol warrant.

headline.main: Iran Makes New Arrests in Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Iran Makes New Arrests In Fraud Case
headline.seo: New Arrests and Interrogations in Iran Fraud Case
